info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 2:01PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...HEAT INDEX VALUES BETWEEN 107 AND 110 DEGREES ARE EXPECTED THIS AFTERNOON... The combination of very warm temperatures and high dewpoints will produce heat indices between 107 and 110 degrees across portions of the lower and middle Rio Grande Valley as well as across inland portions of Willacy county this afternoon. A heat index of 112 degrees may be possible for an hour or two in a few locations. Residents with outdoor activities planned are urged to drink plenty of water, wear light weight and light colored clothing and take frequent breaks from the heat. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. This is especially true during warm or hot weather when car interiors can reach lethal temperatures in a matter of minutes.
